metadata.title: CVE-2017-17090 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in chan_skinny.c in Asterisk Open Source 13.18.2and older, 14.7.2 and older, and 15.1.2 and older, and Certified Asterisk13.13-cert7 and older. If the chan_skinny (aka SCCP protocol) channeldriver is flooded with certain requests, it can cause the asterisk processto use excessive amounts of virtual memory, eventually causing asterisk tostop processing requests of any kind.

criterions.comment: asterisk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
